meanings.definition: Present or publish (something) in serial form.
meanings.sent1: She serialises her stories in a magazine every month.
meanings.sent2: The TV show serialises new episodes every week.
meanings.sent3: The author decided to serialise her novel on social media for fun.
meanings.sent4: His life seemed to serialise into chapters of unexpected events.
meanings.sent5: The artist's work serialises the beauty of nature in each painting.

meanings.definition: To arrange or organize (something) in a series or sequence.
meanings.sent1: He serialises his comic book collection by publication date.
meanings.sent2: The librarian serialises the books on the shelves by genre.
meanings.sent3: The chef serialises the ingredients before starting to cook.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts serialise into a coherent plan for the project.
meanings.sent5: The teacher serialises the lesson into easy-to-follow steps for the students.
